CatDescriptText: Miss Aletha Fearbry, 1537 Pryor Way, North Side, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, November 9, 1957, pg. 2 with question: "Do you believe that licensed taverns are as harmful to a neighborhood as speakeasies and gambling joints? Why?" answer reads: "No, because the taverns are licensed and the authorities know about them.  However, the speakeasies and gambling joints are businesses in which the profit is made solely for the owners."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Aletha Fearbry, wearing houndstooth coat with three buttons, holding fringed scarf, standing in front of wire fence with buildings in background
